body:
Humans possess an adaptability and expansionist verve, driven by endless fonts of ambition and imagination. Such traits have allowed them to spread across the face of the world, acclimating to an endless variety of lands and conquering each new frontier. While often perceived as aggressive and destructive by farther-sighted races, most humans seek merely to use what time they're given to live their lives to the fullest. Able negotiators and adaptors, even those peoples who fall beneath humanity's endless march are often assimilated, becoming new resources fueling the race's endless cultural adventurism.

Humans demonstrate immense diversity in their physical appearance, with skin ranging from dusky hues to milky pallor, and hair running the gamut from flaxen to ebon. Where they might be found also varies widely, settlers and ambitious human explorers finding their ways into the hearts of the most barren deserts, to the frigid coasts of icy seas, even into the sweltering depths of the earth, all seemingly united in an impossible, endless quest to chart what lies over the next horizon. Human diversity extends to every field of study as well, as their curiosity leads them to unlimited opportunities, endlessly striving for mastery.
name: Humans

sections.body: Human adventurers specialize in every career, their talent and ambition driving them not just to succeed but to achieve greatness, founding legacies to endure long past their short lifespans.
sections.name: Human Adventurers

sections.body: Sometimes dismissed as eccentrics and dabblers in dangerous arts, the practical skills of human alchemists always find them employment, if often at a safe distance from their employers.
sections.name: Alchemist

sections.body: From steaming jungles to the desolate steppes, barbarians shun “civilized” society, winning esteem by their toughness, steely confidence, and indomitable prowess. Even in savagery the race's inventiveness shines through, leading human barbarians to often create and master a variety of crude but deadly weapons and fighting styles.
sections.name: Barbarian

sections.body: Human bards show little inhibition but great artistic range. They often prove intensely curious, collecting stories and histories, building their personal legends while they retell the tales of others.
sections.name: Bard

sections.body: Humans form the backbone of many cavalier orders, balancing an aristocratic gentility with dedication to serving their liege and the chivalric ideal, earning the esteem of commoners and nobility alike.
sections.name: Cavalier

sections.body: Humans readily believe in ideals larger than themselves and flock to religions great and small. Humans often form personal connections with deities, embodying traits and forces they idealize.
sections.name: Cleric

sections.body: Druidism is regarded by many humans as an “old faith,” eternal and as all-encompassing as the world itself. Though some dismiss them as backward hermits standing in the way of progress, druids often garner a measure of both wary respect and suspicious fear.
sections.name: Druid

sections.body: Human fighters run the gamut of professions—from wanderers and soldiers to swashbucklers and brawlers—but are never people to be trifled with.
sections.name: Fighter

sections.body: While capable of faith and trust, humans are equally susceptible to paranoia and suspicion, and entire orders of mostly human inquisitors have earned fame (or infamy) through their purges of dangerous creatures and tenacious witch hunts.
sections.name: Inquisitor

sections.body: Craving peace and the discipline of perfection, human monks often stand apart from society. While many admire monks, only the most dedicated possess the clarity and self-control to master their ways.
sections.name: Monk

sections.body: Human oracles employ a variety of cultic arts to reveal the essence and outlook of the oracle. What agents these seers might employ in their strange arts varies mildly, often reflecting mysterious truths.
sections.name: Oracle

sections.body: Humans aspiring to heroic ideals, seeking noble ways to defend their people, or merely aspiring to lofty ideas of honor and heroism, often gravitate to the paladin class. Though a difficult and often self-sacrificing road, human paladins charge to the forefront of nearly any crusade against the forces of evil.
sections.name: Paladin

sections.body: Humans challenge themselves to best every kind of prey, leading many to become skilled hunters and trackers of beasts and even deadlier quarries. Over time, many human rangers come to prefer the company of animals to that of people.
sections.name: Ranger

sections.body: Ambitious, sometimes to a fault, human rogues defy all barriers to gain what they desire. Whether as unscrupulous assassins or dashing thieves, few can resist the deceptions and charms of such determined scoundrels.
sections.name: Rogue

sections.body: With a long history of commingled bloodlines, humans frequently display latent arcane power. Sometimes denounced as freaks or praised as marvels, sorcerers must rely on their inner strength to survive.
sections.name: Sorcerer

sections.body: Shaping life and commanding terrors with their every word, human summoners embrace the powers of creation. Eidolons under their command might take a vast variety of shapes, typically being manifestations of their masters' deepest hopes or darkest nightmares.
sections.name: Summoner

sections.body: The human lust for mastery over the world sometimes leads down mysterious and potentially dangerous routes, such as that of the reclusive witch.
sections.name: Witch

sections.body: Many humans seek power, knowledge, and insights into the secrets of creation, leading human wizards to seek out ancient mysteries of arcane lore and new magical innovations. Humans excel both at mastering specific schools of magic and in more universal studies.
sections.name: Wizard

sections.body: The following racial traits replace existing human racial traits. Consult your GM before selecting any of these new options.

Humans have great intuition for hidden potential. They gain a +2 bonus on Sense Motive checks. In addition, when they acquire an animal companion, bonded mount, cohort, or familiar, that creature gains a +2 bonus to one ability score of the character's choice. This racial trait replaces the bonus feat racial trait.
sections.name: Eye for Talent
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Races/Humans/Alternate Racial Traits/Eye for Talent

sections.body: Humans born in rural areas are used to hard labor. They gain a bonus equal to half their character level to any one Craft or Profession skill, and once per day they may ignore an effect that would cause them to become fatigued or exhausted. This racial trait replaces the skilled racial trait.
sections.name: Heart of the Fields
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Races/Humans/Alternate Racial Traits/Heart of the Fields

sections.body: Humans from bustling cities are skilled with crowds. They gain a +1 bonus on Reflex saves and a +1 dodge bonus to Armor Class when adjacent to at least two other allies. Crowds do not count as difficult terrain for them. This racial trait replaces the skilled racial trait.
sections.name: Heart of the Streets
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Races/Humans/Alternate Racial Traits/Heart of the Streets

sections.body: Humans raised in the wild learn the hard way that only the strong survive. They gain a bonus equal to half their character level on Survival checks. They also gain a +5 bonus on Constitution checks to stabilize when dying and add half their character level to their Constitution score when determining the negative hit point total necessary to kill them. This racial trait replaces the skilled racial trait.
sections.name: Heart of the Wilderness
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Races/Humans/Alternate Racial Traits/Heart of the Wilderness

sections.name: Alternate Racial Traits

sections.body: Instead of receiving an additional skill rank or hit point whenever they gain a level in a favored class, humans have the option of choosing from a number of other bonuses, depending upon their favored class. The following options are available to all humans who have the listed favored class, and unless otherwise stated, the bonus applies each time you select the listed favored class reward.
Add one extract formulae from the alchemist's list to the character's formulae book. This formulae must be at least one level below the highest formulae level the alchemist can create.
sections.name: Alchemist

sections.body: Add a +1/2 bonus to trap sense or +1/3 to the bonus from the superstitious rage power.
sections.name: Barbarian

sections.body: Add one spell known from the bard spell list. This spell must be at least one level below the highest spell level the bard can cast.
sections.name: Bard

sections.body: Add +1/4 to the cavalier's banner bonus.
sections.name: Cavalier

sections.body: Add +1 on caster level checks made to overcome the spell resistance of outsiders.
sections.name: Cleric

sections.body: Add a +1/2 bonus on Diplomacy and Intimidate checks to change a creature's attitude.
sections.name: Druid

sections.body: Add +1 to the fighter's CMD when resisting two combat maneuvers of the character's choice.
sections.name: Fighter

sections.body: Add one spell known from the inquisitor spell list. This spell must be at least one level below the highest spell level the inquisitor can cast.
sections.name: Inquisitor

sections.body: Add +1/4 to the monk's ki pool.
sections.name: Monk

sections.body: Add one spell known from the oracle spell list. This spell must be at least one level below the highest spell level the oracle can cast.
sections.name: Oracle

sections.body: Add +1 to the paladin's energy resistance to one kind of energy (maximum +10).
sections.name: Paladin

sections.body: Add +1 hit point or +1 skill rank to the ranger's animal companion. If the ranger ever replaces his companion, the new companion gains these bonus hit points or skill ranks.
sections.name: Ranger

sections.body: The human gains +1/6 of a new rogue talent.
sections.name: Rogue

sections.body: Add one spell known from the sorcerer spell list. This spell must be at least one level below the highest spell level the sorcerer can cast.
sections.name: Sorcerer

sections.body: Add +1 hit point or +1 skill rank to the summoner's eidolon.
sections.name: Summoner

sections.body: Add one spell from the witch spell list to the witch's familiar. This spell must be at least one level below the highest spell level she can cast. If the witch ever replaces her familiar, the new familiar knows these bonus spells.
sections.name: Witch

sections.body: Add one spell from the wizard spell list to the wizard's spellbook. This spell must be at least one level below the highest spell level he can cast.
sections.name: Wizard
